subject: Design
title: The World Wide Web: Designing Open Information
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The World Wide Web: Designing Open Information.

hook.text: In 1991, Tim Berners-Lee designed a system where any document could link to any other.

buildup.text: The web wasn't a visual design â€” it was an information architecture. Pages, links, and URLs.

discovery.text: By making it open and free, Berners-Lee ensured no company could own the web's design.

twist.text: He could have patented it and become the richest person alive. He gave it away instead.

climax.text: That design decision â€” openness â€” is why 5 billion people use the web today.

punchline.text: The web's greatest design choice was giving it away.
